results.description: Uses SUGGESTION1 by combining returns and short-term volatility. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill applied if coverage low. SUGGESTION4: uses high-coverage fields (close) to improve signal. Complies with KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation short, <=7 operators, <=2 datafields. Confidence set to 0.75 based on commonality of momentum signals.

Combines SUGGESTION1 (longer return horizon) and uses ts_zscore to reduce outliers. No vector fields so SUGGESTION2 N/A. ts_backfill considered if coverage<0.6. Uses close only (high userCount). Confidence 0.72.
Applies SUGGESTION1 with returns and moving average. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Uses ts_av_diff to measure deviation. Keeps implementation compact. Confidence 0.65.
Combines returns and recent stddev (SUGGESTION1). Scales by ts_std_dev to prefer stable strength. No vector fields. ts_backfill considered for low coverage fields. Confidence 0.70.
Uses both close and volume (SUGGESTION1). vec ops N/A. If volume coverage low, ts_backfill applied. Implements volume relative spike and positive return filter. Confidence 0.68.
Combines returns and volume to favor high-return low-volume names (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if coverage low. Keeps operators minimal. Confidence 0.60.
Uses earnings surprise and short-term returns (SUGGESTION1). No vector fields. If surprise coverage limited, apply ts_backfill. Confidence 0.73 based on known post-earnings drift.
Combines analyst revisions count and subsequent returns. SUGGESTION1 used. If revisions sparse, ts_backfill used. Confidence 0.66.
Uses short_interest and recent open-to-close returns (SUGGESTION1). No vector fields. ts_backfill if short_interest coverage low. High expected alpha if shorts unwind. Confidence 0.62.
Uses implied_volatility and its zscore to find reversion opportunities. SUGGESTION1 applied. ts_backfill if IV series incomplete. Confidence 0.64.
Combines implied_volatility and options_oi (vector) â€” SUGGESTION2 wraps vector with vec_sum. If OI low coverage, ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION1 used to merge both. Confidence 0.59.
Fundamental factor using cash_flow_from_ops to prefer high cash yields. Single datafield used; SUGGESTION1 partially applied. Coverage likely good so ts_backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.
Uses roic and price returns to capture quality-driven outperformance (SUGGESTION1). Both fields usually available; no backfill. Confidence 0.66.
Combines pe_ratio and analyst_revision_delta (SUGGESTION1). Low PE names with upgrades expected to re-rate. ts_backfill if revisions sparse. Confidence 0.58.
Uses dividend_yield and dividend_change to pick rising-dividend stocks (SUGGESTION1). Coverage moderate; apply ts_backfill when needed. Confidence 0.55.
Accounts anomaly: high accruals predict lower future returns. Uses accruals and recent returns; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.60.
Uses insider_trades (vector) wrapped with vec_sum per SUGGESTION2 and short-term returns. If vector sparse, ts_backfill applied. Confidence 0.63.
Calendar effect using ts_step to bucket months and average returns. SUGGESTION1 N/A. Implementation respects operator limits. Confidence 0.50 (weaker signal).
Combines sudden volume spike and price move to detect index inclusion rebalancing (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill optional. Confidence 0.67.
Uses close and sector benchmark returns to create relative momentum. SUGGESTION1 used. Group operator avoided to respect KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.66.
Ranks stocks by recent return volatility and prefers mid-vol names (SUGGESTION1). Uses ts_std_dev and quantile to produce cross-sectional score. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Liquidity provider pick: low spread high turnover
results.description: Combines bid_ask_spread and volume to favor tight-spread high-turnover names (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if spread data missing. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Momentum trimmed by size (smaller cap alpha)
results.description: Combines market_cap and returns; favors small caps with momentum (SUGGESTION1). Keeps 2 datafields. Confidence 0.62.
Combines accruals (quality proxy) and returns per SUGGESTION1. Negative accruals imply higher quality; multiply by momentum. Confidence 0.64.
Uses debt_equity to penalize leveraged momentum names (SUGGESTION1). Keeps simple operators. Confidence 0.58.
Detects extreme 1d moves using zscore and bets on reversal (mean reversion). SUGGESTION1 used; ts_zscore applied. Confidence 0.57.
Uses ts_corr between two stocks (related pair) to detect divergence. SUGGESTION1 with 2 datafields. ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.65.
Uses ts_arg_max on returns to find instruments making new highs relative to lookback (SUGGESTION1). Simple, low operator count. Confidence 0.68.
Uses ts_returns and group_neutralize to remove sector bets. KEEP_IN_MIND4: group used as group parameter. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.71.
Uses analyst revisions and their ts_delta to capture acceleration in upgrades (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if revision series sparse. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Post-earnings drift scaled by surprise magnitude
results.description: Combines earnings_surprise magnitude and subsequent returns (SUGGESTION1). Uses ts_backfill if surprise data missing. Confidence 0.72.
Uses news_sentiment_vector wrapped with vec_avg per SUGGESTION2 and price returns. If coverage low, ts_backfill used. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.66.
Uses social_mentions_vector via vec_sum and short returns to capture retail-driven moves (SUGGESTION2 & 1). ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.58.
Combines buy_sell_imbalance and 5d returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Use ts_backfill when orderflow incomplete. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: High short interest + positive news = squeeze bet
results.description: Combines short_interest and news_sentiment (vec_avg) per SUGGESTION2 & 1. ts_backfill if either sparse. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Relative value: PB vs sector median
results.description: Uses pb_ratio and group_mean to compute relative cheapness (SUGGESTION1, KEEP_IN_MIND4 group used). Confidence 0.59.
Combines ts_returns and insider_trades_vector (vec_sum) per SUGGESTION2 & 1. ts_backfill when insider data sparse. Confidence 0.64.
Normalizes momentum by market beta to find idiosyncratic winners (SUGGESTION1). Beta often available; ts_backfill optional. Confidence 0.67.
Uses implied_volatility zscore and returns to catch options-driven moves around earnings. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.60.
Combines inventory_delta and revenue surprise (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if inventories sparse. Confidence 0.54.
Classic value: reverse of market_cap/book_value combined with recent returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.
Computes stock return minus sector mean return (SUGGESTION1). Uses group_mean (KEEP_IN_MIND4 group). Confidence 0.65.
Combines dividend_change and roic to favor sustainable payers (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by accruals (avoid poor earnings quality)
results.description: Removes momentum signals in high accrual names by multiplying momentum with reversed accruals. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Uses call_sentiment_vector (vec_avg) and post-ER returns; SUGGESTION2 & 1 applied. ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.67.
Uses ts_quantile on recent returns to pick extreme positive momentum (SUGGESTION1). Simple and compact. Confidence 0.66.
Uses ts_corr between equity returns and commodity/currency to find decoupling (SUGGESTION1). Two datafields used. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Growth at a reasonable price momentum
results.description: Combines earnings growth and inverse pe_ratio to favor growing cheap stocks (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.60.
Uses bid_ask_imbalance and immediate return to capture short-term reversal (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if imbalance sparse. Confidence 0.59.
Uses days_since_ipo and short-term returns to capture post-IPO drift (SUGGESTION1). If days_since_ipo missing, ts_backfill not applicable; lower confidence. Confidence 0.52.
Combines buyback_announced and returns to capture repurchase-driven lift (SUGGESTION1). Backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum dampened by option open interest
results.description: Penalizes momentum by heavy options OI (vec_sum) to avoid crowded options squeezes (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for earnings calendar density
results.description: Downweights names with upcoming earnings using days_to_earnings and momentum (SUGGESTION1). Keeps operators minimal. Confidence 0.60.
Uses analyst_count and returns to prefer well-covered names (SUGGESTION1 & 4). If coverage metric low, ts_backfill. Confidence 0.55.
Uses ts_ir of returns to find persistent winners (SUGGESTION1). ts_ir operator applied. Confidence 0.63.
Compares earnings_surprise to group_mean(surprise) using group_mean (KEEP_IN_MIND4). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.66.
Combines zscores of momentum and value (SUGGESTION1) and aggregates with add. Keeps <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.68.
Uses ts_std_dev on returns and volume filter to pick liquid volatility breakouts (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum fade after extreme quantile move
results.description: Uses ts_quantile to detect extreme recent moves and reverses them. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.
Captures weekday patterns: uses ts_step with group_mean. SUGGESTION1 N/A. Simple and short. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Mean reversion on high intraday range
results.description: Uses high and low to compute intraday range and then reverse short-term returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by free cash flow yield
results.description: Combines free_cash_flow / market_cap with returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.61.
Adds earnings_surprise and analyst_revision_delta to capture accelerating fundamental improvements (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.62.
Applies hump to reduce turnover on momentum signal (SUGGESTION1). Keeps operators <=7. Confidence 0.69.
Uses ts_decay_linear to smooth momentum signal (SUGGESTION1). Implementation short. Confidence 0.68.
Applies winsorize to remove outliers from returns before ranking (SUGGESTION1). Keeps <=2 fields. Confidence 0.67.
Ranks stocks by ts_std_dev and prefers low-vol names (SUGGESTION1). Simple and compact. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by analyst target upgrades
results.description: Combines analyst_target_change with returns to capture re-rating (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if target changes sparse. Confidence 0.60.
Uses revenue_surprise and subsequent return persistence measured by ts_ir (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.57.
Computes stock minus industry median return using group_mean (KEEP_IN_MIND4). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Compares realized (ts_std_dev of returns) vs implied_volatility to capture mispricings (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Crowdedness signal: low float * high call OI
results.description: Combines float (low) and options_oi_vector (vec_sum) per SUGGESTION2 & 1 to detect crowding risk/opportunity. Confidence 0.56.
Uses days_to_lockup_expiry and recent returns to capture post-lockup flows (SUGGESTION1). Coverage may be sparse; ts_backfill optional. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Relative momentum between market cap buckets
results.description: Compares momentum in small vs large cap using group_mean with bucketed market_cap. SUGGESTION1 & KEEP_IN_MIND applied. Confidence 0.60.
Uses block_trade_indicator and short returns to capture temporary price pressure (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if indicator sparse. Confidence 0.58.
Applies group_zscore to momentum to remove group-level effects (KEEP_IN_MIND4). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.70.
Uses accruals zscore to short accounting-weak firms. SUGGESTION1 used with single datafield. Confidence 0.62.
Detects month-end flows by combining ts_step and volume spikes per SUGGESTION1. Group ops not required. Confidence 0.51.
Uses days_from_last_change on dividend and short-term returns to capture ex-date effects (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.50.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for earnings growth variability
results.description: Divides returns by ts_std_dev of earnings_growth to favor stable growers (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.59.
Combines supplier_news_sentiment_vector (vec_avg) with revenue_surprise to detect upstream risks (SUGGESTION2 & 1). ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.54.
Uses group_std_dev of returns to target stocks with high idiosyncratic dispersion (SUGGESTION1). KEEP_IN_MIND4 group used. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Mean reversion after extreme volume days
results.description: Combines extreme volume indicator and reversal of intraday returns (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill applied if volume sparse. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum enhanced by positive free cash flow change
results.description: Multiplying momentum by FCF growth (SUGGESTION1). Simple and compact. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by short borrow cost
results.description: Penalizes momentum where borrow_cost is high (SUGGESTION1). Keep operators minimal. Confidence 0.55.
Uses implied_volatility_skew and recent call OI (vec_sum) per SUGGESTION2 & 1. ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.56.
Compares revenue_growth to industry group mean (KEEP_IN_MIND4). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.60.
Uses overnight gap (close vs previous close) and intraday follow-through returns (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if price series has gaps. Confidence 0.58.
Applies winsorize to fundamental ratio (PE) before combining with momentum (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.59.
Short names with sudden dividend_cut_indicator and negative revisions (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill if cut data sparse. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum corroborated by insider buying and analyst upgrades
results.description: Adds insider_trades_vector (vec_sum) and analyst_revision_delta with returns. SUGGESTION1 & 2 applied. ts_backfill if sparse. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Gap-up mean reversion after low liquidity
results.description: Detects gap-ups and applies reversal when volume is low relative to history (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.56.
Uses scale or group_scale to make momentum comparable within groups (KEEP_IN_MIND4). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.69.
Combines changes in options_oi_vector (vec_sum of delta) with 1d returns (SUGGESTION2 & 1). ts_backfill if OI sparse. Confidence 0.58.
Applies tail to cap extreme momentum values to reduce risk (SUGGESTION1). Simple implementation. Confidence 0.66.
Uses M&A rumour_score_vector (vec_avg) and abnormal volume to detect takeover candidates (SUGGESTION2 & 1). ts_backfill if rumours sparse. Confidence 0.55.
Applies normalize then quantile to momentum to produce robust cross-sectional bets (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.70.

results.idea: Earnings beat momentum in small caps
results.description: Combines earnings_surprise and inverse market_cap to favor small-cap beats (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.63.
Uses ts_kurtosis or ts_kurtosis on vol series (if available) to capture VIX-like shocks; here use ts_kurtosis of returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.52.
Uses ts_target_tvr_decay to tune momentum vector for desired turnover (SUGGESTION1). Keeps operators minimal. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion on high IV names
results.description: Targets reversal in high implied_volatility names after big moves (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.58.
Requires both positive momentum and analyst_revision_delta to be positive (SUGGESTION1). Simple AND combine. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Momentum in names with stable fundamentals
results.description: Favors momentum where earnings volatility low: divide returns by ts_std_dev(earnings, period) (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: High short-interest reversal after positive sentiment
results.description: Combines short_interest and news_sentiment_vector (vec_avg) to find squeeze candidates (SUGGESTION2 & 1). Confidence 0.60.
